4.5.1.title: Pipe and Hole Capacity
4.5.1.content:
**Circular Area:**
```
Capacity (bbl/ft) = ID² ÷ 1029.4
```

**Volume:**
```
Volume (bbl) = Capacity (bbl/ft) × Length (ft)
```

**Example:**
5" drillpipe with 4.276" ID, 10,000 ft:

Capacity = 4.276² ÷ 1029.4 = 0.0178 bbl/ft
Volume = 0.0178 × 10,000 = 178 bbl

4.5.2.title: Annular Volume
4.5.2.content:
**Annulus Between Pipe and Hole/Casing:**
```
Annular Capacity = (Hole ID² - Pipe OD²) ÷ 1029.4
```

**Example:**
8.5" hole with 5" drillpipe:

Capacity = (8.5² - 5²) ÷ 1029.4
Capacity = (72.25 - 25) ÷ 1029.4 = 0.0459 bbl/ft

**For 5,000 ft:**
Volume = 0.0459 × 5,000 = 230 bbl

4.5.3.title: Total Well Volume
4.5.3.content:
**Sum All Sections:**
```
Total Volume = Drillstring Volume + Annular Volume
```

**Drillstring:**
- DP internal volume
- HWDP internal volume
- DC internal volume
- Bit nozzle area (negligible)

**Annulus:**
- DC × open hole annulus
- HWDP × open hole annulus
- DP × open hole annulus
- DP × casing annulus

**Example Calculation:**
See kill sheet for detailed well volume breakdown.

4.5.4.title: Mud Volume Requirements
4.5.4.content:
**Minimum Active Volume:**
```
Active Volume ≥ Well Volume × 2
```

**Kill Mud Volume:**
```
Kill Mud Required = Well Volume + Reserve (typically 50-100 bbl)
```

**Weight-Up Material:**
```
Barite Required (sacks) = [ΔMW × Volume × 14.9] ÷ [35.4 - Current MW]
```

Where ΔMW is weight increase needed

**Example:**
Increase from 10.5 to 11.5 ppg (Δ = 1.0 ppg)
Volume = 500 bbl

Barite = [1.0 × 500 × 14.9] ÷ [35.4 - 10.5]
Barite = 7,450 ÷ 24.9 = 299 sacks (100 lb sacks)
